unit: Unit 7 | Inference for Quantitative Data: Means
title: Track Times
question_text: Suppose Jimmy and Bobby are two long-time competitors on the same track team in the $400$ -meter dash. Jimmy and Bobby have ran $10$ races this year. Jimmy has averaged $56.2$ seconds with a standard deviation of $1.3$ seconds, while Bobby has averaged $55.8$ seconds with a standard deviation of $1.3$ seconds. Bobby asked the coach to perform a two-sample T-test to determine if he is significantly better than Jimmy this year. What conclusion does the coach make?

choices.text: Any inferential procedure in this context does not make sense.
Bobby is faster at the alpha 5 % 5 % level, but not at the 1 % 1 % level.
Jimmy is faster at the alpha 5 % 5 % level, but not at the 1 % 1 % level.
Bobby is faster at the alpha 1 % 1 % level.
There is insufficient evidence at the alpha 10 % 10 % level to determine who is faster.
